Episodes.Title: Jefferson: My Name On A Plaque
Episodes.Plot: Rookie A.J. Cafaro questions if he is cut out for law enforcement after witnessing his first dead body; English teacher Hugh Herndon gives up teaching to go into law enforcement.

Episodes.Title: Tampa: Class Begins
Episodes.Plot: Jefferson Parish rookie Mark Monson has trouble taking orders from his female FTO; rookie Henry Conravey and his FTO respond to a shots fired call in a quiet neighborhood.

Episodes.Title: Jefferson: One More Time
Episodes.Plot: Mark Monson is going to be assessed by his sergeant again; if Mark passes his evaluation he gets his own squad car, if he fails his law enforcement career is over.

Episodes.Title: Tampa: Size Doesn't Matter
Episodes.Plot: Rookie Amy Hess tries to prove that size doesn't matter; rookie Tommie Tolbert tries to stop a victim from retaliating and then tries to catch a fleeing criminal.

Episodes.Title: Jefferson: The Shootout
Episodes.Plot: Rookie and father-to-be Dennis Cooper starts to question his choices after having to deal with a grieving husband; rookie Hugh Herndon has passed his first week of the rookie training program.

Episodes.Title: Tampa: The Birth of a Rookie
Episodes.Plot: Rookie Josh Norris meets his FTO Danny Bostic; Josh fails to impress Danny on their first call and then puts himself in danger on a disturbance call.

Episodes.Title: Jefferson: Toy Gun
Episodes.Plot: Rookie Elton Johnson gets to be part of the action when he is the arresting officer on a drug sting operation and must deal with a racist drunk; rookie April Levine investigates a knifing and goes on her first drug sting.

Episodes.Title: Tampa: A Deer in Headlights
Episodes.Plot: Rookie Rebecca Webster was the only female rookie in her academy class and tries to do everything on her own; rookie John Wieblet and his FTO notice a man brandishing an assault rifle.

Episodes.Title: Jefferson: Riding Solo
Episodes.Plot: Rookie Henry Conravey has completed 12 weeks of training and has everything he learned put to the test when he rides with his sergeant; rookie Chris Cade makes a critical error on a traffic stop.

Episodes.Title: Tampa: There's a New FTO in Town
Episodes.Plot: Simple tasks seem to become more complicated for Tampa rookie Amy Hess; fellow rookie Dennis Cooper loses his squad car and the evidence from a drug arrest.

Episodes.Title: Jefferson: Rookie Love
Episodes.Plot: Rookie Rebecca Webster's FTO expresses concern when she makes a potentially fatal mistake while attempting to capture an armed suspect; Rebecca's boyfriend is also a rookie with the department.

Episodes.Title: Tampa: It's a "Deadly" Profession
Episodes.Plot: Rookie April Levine responds to two dead body calls; rookie Tommie Tolbert's FTO confronts him about his poor driving.

Episodes.Title: Jefferson: The Lost Rookie
Episodes.Plot: Narcotics hit; a robbery case; dispersing some rowdy kids; filling out paperwork; proper gun stance.

Episodes.Title: Tampa: Command Presence
Episodes.Plot: K-9 unit dog training; domestic dispute; entry team on a search warrant; traffic stop.

Episodes.Title: Jefferson: Step Up or Step Off
Episodes.Plot: Foot chase; traffic tickets and reports.

Episodes.Title: Tampa: Finding the Cop Voice
Episodes.Plot: Vincent Capo went from being a chef to becoming a JPSO rookie police officer in less than a year.  FTO Mike Pizzulato is concerned that Vince's shyness and difficulty in communicating with others will hold him back.
